wiki.content: According to the Guiding Light Songfacts , lyrically this power ballad is influenced by the love story between Winston Smith and Julia in George Orwell's novel about a future repressive totalitarian regime, 1984. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: According to the Guiding Light Songfacts , lyrically this power ballad is influenced by the love story between Winston Smith and Julia in George Orwell's novel about a future repressive totalitarian regime, 1984.

track.name: Guiding Light
comments: absolutely amazing song! i like the solo so much!
It sounds more olympic than that weak shit called Survival. Great music, but my dream is to hear how James Hetfield from 1990 sings it. His powerful voice + composition = true epicness!
I never really liked this song until I saw it live. :)

/////////""Their worst song I think" You obviously haven't heard Undisclosed Desires " //////////////... are you kidding? Undisclosed Desires may not be Butterflies and Hurricanes, but it's still a KILLER song. And I don't mind Guiding Light, it's just not Dead Star or Fury.
"It's good... but they've got better. This doesn't compare to anything on OoS or Absolution."  [+2]
I'm definitely a fan of this one, especially Matt's vocals towards the end.
Fucking love this. The guitar work and Matt's voice at the end make this so chilling. My favorite song on The Resistance.
I don't understand all the hate toward this song.
It's good... but they've got better. This doesn't compare to anything on OoS or Absolution.
cool song...so powerful and beautiful! vocals during the solo is so amazing...LOVE IT!
nice pompous track. if they'd just made the rhythm slightly different, it wouldn't be blatantly ultravox
Love it. Feel free to hate on Neutron Star Collision, Starlight, etc. but not this. This right here is fucking fantastic.
